poem:
Title: "The Unyielding Seeds of Industry"

Unseen hands wring the essence of the Earth,
Engineers huddle in the shadow of the dawn.
A titan sways, silent in its girth,
Rejects the eastern lure, a pawn reborn.

Change whispers in the language of the market,
Fraught with the anguish of underacheived dreams.
Yet, scorned by the surety of Sparta's trumpet,
On the sturdy bough, sovereignty gleams.
